description: List of references. At least one reference needed.

title.description: Title of book, journal article, or website.
title.example: A Practical Model for Subsurface Light Transport

author.description: Name(s) of the authors of a book or journal article, or in the case of a webpage, the person or company that created the webpage. For editors, add "(Ed.)"
author.example: Jensen, H. W., Marschner, S. R., Levoy, M. & Hanrahan, P.

url.description: Link to website, or other web resource where the information was found. For books and journals, this URL should be the one that the DOI is linking to.

publisher.description: Name of publisher or journal where published.
publisher.example: Proceedings of the 28th Annual Conference on Computer Graphics and Interactive Techniques

volume.description: Volume number. In relation to periodicals, volume refers to all the issues of a specific journal or magazine for a limited time period, usually one year. For books, volume indicates the order of a book in a series or set.

issue.description: Issue number. The issue number refers to the number of individual publications during the year.

pages.description: Pages in book or journal article, separated by double-hyphens. Can also be article number.

year.description: Year of publication. For webpages, use "accessed" instead.
